subject: vam pro is not working properly
description_text:
Hello.

When I use the VAM Pro, it quickly loses connection with the software and turns into a piece of junk that only produces constant, monotonous vibrations. I’m using USB 3.0 and have tried various things such as firmware upgrades, but nothing fixes the issue. Please tell me how to solve this. I am using the full Pro X Ultra pedal package.

conversations.body_text: Hi n j,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.      https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding     https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1n291hi/solution_for_simsonn_vam_pro_emi_issues/

So, does that mean the issue will be solved if I connect the PC chassis and the pedal stand with a grounding wire?
Is there no particular requirement for grounding the stand, as long as it’s simply connected?

________________________________
差出人: support@simsonn.com
Hi n j,  Yes, the PC case, the stand, and the control unit should be properly connected, but be careful that paint layers do not interfere with the contact.
